Reviews.Title: “Pile of poop, cockroaches, dirty feet/looks and cramped rooms”
Reviews.Author: runnershigh8
Reviews.Content: I write this review acknowledging that others may not have as bad of an experience as we did. First, we were part of a small group of the unlucky ones... we were put into a second building (not the main one where most other guests are staying) which put us further away (just across the way, but still inconvenient) from the main facilities (breakfast, laundry, the main lounge room), and that I am pretty sure that our room was the smallest one in the building. The good: 1) Cheap enough (for Singapore), 2) located right next to the Aljunied MTR station, 3) clean/comfy beds, and 4) good WiFi and internet access. The bad: 1) We had an extremely small and cramped room (if my arms were a bit longer, my arm span could reach from wall to wall). We couldn't open up the door without it slamming into our luggage. 2) I'm not sure about the security of the rooms; twice, when our doors were fully closed and even locked, when others down the hall slammed their doors, our door came open. It didn't really ease my mind about the security when we weren't in the room. 3) You aren't allowed to wear shoes inside. This is pretty grody considering what others may be trudging in (and what I saw others trudging in). You aren't even supposed to wear shoes in the bathrooms. And as I saw others wearing shoes inside, when I wore my designated shower sandals in self-defense, I received some pretty nasty looks from others. 4) There is no elevator, which means that we brought our luggage up three stories into the first building, then down, and then up three more stories into the other building. 5) When you book from Hostels/Hostelworld, there is an additional 10% service charge that you have to pay in addition to the rate quoted to you on Hostelworld. We didn't realize this until we looked closely on the print-out. 5) You get to hear EVERYTHING going on in the rooms next to you. The walls were clearly partitioned off by the owners of the hostel in order to create more rooms, meaning that the huge cracks in the wall (via a shared window between two rooms for example) allow for some serious sound travel. I could almost hear the people next door breathing. 6) Also, in the second building, there are a number of semi-permanent residents who live there; two of them were nicer, but I definitely didn't have that "welcome to our hostel" feeling from any of the people who lived/worked there. The ugly: There was literally a pile of steaming, fresh diarrhea to greet us on the first few steps of the staircase into the building... WTH happened there? And an additional freebie of a huge cockroach that presumably died because of the horrific stench of the caca right next to it. It wasn't until about 10 hours after we arrived that someone hosed it off. Also, I didn't learn until the last night of our stay that cockroaches in Singapore can indeed fly. My Singaporean friend had told me this but I had yet to witness it. In the first building, the main hang out room is ACed. In the second building, there is only a fan, and the windows are left open all day/all night long... which also meant that one of the bathrooms was occupied by a huge flying cockroach. I know cockroaches don't bother everyone, but they definitely bother me. My boyfriend and I have been traveling in southeast Asia for about 7 weeks now and this was by far our least favorite place that we stayed in. I know that options in Singapore are extremely limited if you are on a budget (like us), but I would book with caution.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap price”
Reviews.Author: Erik P
Reviews.Content: This hostel is very functional for its value. For less than $20US I got a bed in an 8 bed dorm and a hot shower. My only issue is that they make you pay everything up front to secure your place no matter how many nights. Absolutely no refunds. They will not budge. So if you overpay a night and leave early you just will have to eat the cost. Oh and you'll definitely get a nice dose of athletes foot. You cannot wear shoes or sandals anywhere in the hostel. The bathrooms and showers are quite damp and musty. So just factor that into the savings for treating athletes foot.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hostel but a bit rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: Whale_shark_23
Reviews.Content: Positives- comfortable, clean bed with nice bedding, internet access, lockers, 4 modern shower rooms, next to MRT station, air con, hot showers, movies on TV Negatives- nowhere to change that wasn't wet, unfinished (paint, DIY parts around), very cramped bedroom, hard to find (no sign outside), third floor, poor breakfast (no milk, just dry cornflakes and cheap bread), nobody around to check out with, not that cheap

Reviews.Title: “I recommend”
Reviews.Author: CharmingHoney
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very near the EW 9 Station (Aljunied). Just few steps away, you're in the MRT already though this is located at the 3rd floor so you have to carry your baggage unluckily if heavy. The person in charge was kind and very fluent in english so we never had any problem. We were given access to the main door. Our room and the common bathroom were very clean. The continental breakfast was fine. I recommend this hostel to all budget concious.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure for single female traveler”
Reviews.Author: RaeNZ88
Reviews.Content: OK so first of all, I am not from Singapore, I did not know that Geylang was a mildly dodgy area. The location itself was a bit odd. It was not close to town at all really. I felt a bit weird arriving at night into Aljuneid Station (which admitedly it is very close to) and having men, I know they are Singaporean men but still, watch me as I looked for the hostel. Second, it is split across two very separate buildings with no sign on the stairwell for the second one. I nearly went up the wrong stairwell every time I got back there as I was in the second building. It appeared to have a number of female foreign workers living there, which is fine but changed the atmosphere of the place from backpackerish to hall of residenceish in my opinion. The first night I stayed there was a Saturday and there was quite a bit of road noise until quite late too. I mean, I was ok with it. It was not a bad place to stay, the guy who runs it was nice but it is not what I was used to having backpacked in Australia, New Zealand, Japan and the UK. I wouldn't stay there by myself again, especially since it's a bit out of central Singpore, but if I was with my partner or a friend, maybe.

Reviews.Title: “surely not going to back”
Reviews.Author: silviola86
Reviews.Content: I Stayed there 8 nights. Good things: location is good, free internet, laundry service, tv room. the place was dirty, we booked a 8 ppl room but one of our friends could not come so we thought we could have had a spare bad but there was a random Korean guy in our room (first: we were all girls, second: we did not say that our friends was not coming, what if she was there?) There are 4 toilets for something like 60 ppl and we were all there for a conference so all waking up at the same time...kitchen is in front of two of the toilet. breakfast include toast and jam and cereals (but bring your own milk) The picture they postes in hostelbookers are not reflecting the reality as the 8 ppl room is 3 time bigger than what it is in reality.

Reviews.Title: ““Great place to stay in!””
Reviews.Author: melinda2810
Reviews.Content: Private room with AC, 24-hrs wifi, very friendly staff, shower room was clean, 300m from MTR...excellent choice in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in!”
Reviews.Author: goldencleo88
Reviews.Content: My kids and I enjoyed our 6 days stay in the hostel. The manager, Son, gave us a room for ourselves which was what we really wanted. If you want to meet people, they have boarding rooms. Our private room suited our needs and we were a stone's throw away from the MRT. Shower rooms were clean, our room was air-conditioned and we had 24-hrs wifi. Good value for money!

HotelInfo.Name: Wow Hostels
HotelInfo.Address: 67B Lor 27 Geylang, Singapore 388189, Singapore
